Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great time at Penn! Locus Walk was especially vibrant and the engaged student community hustling about really made it special. One change I’d love to see is more interdisciplinary events to bring even more diverse ideas together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food poor food
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Since I don’t have personal experiences, I can summarize what students and alumni commonly say about the University of Pennsylvania (UPenn).

What Students Like About UPenn:

1. Strong Academics & Resources – UPenn is known for its rigorous academics, especially in business (Wharton), law, medicine, and social sciences. Students appreciate the interdisciplinary approach, allowing them to take courses across different schools.

4. Extracurriculars & Student Life – With over 450 clubs, students can engage in research, entrepreneurship, community service, and cultural organizations.                                                 2. i would like see change Competitive Culture – Some students feel UPenn has a "pre-professional" and competitive atmosphere, particularly in business and finance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being here at UPenn it sure has been interesting. It has great academics but is very competitive environment that can often be difficult.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that professors and clinical instructors are collaborating in preparing us for the workforce and training us to be independent leaders.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s been really nice. At times, it can be overwhelming but as long as you find your people, you’ll be okay.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved going to school in Philadelphia. Penn's campus is beautifully situated in the city and I was super fortunate to be able to go there. I was a student-athlete and I was able to make very good friends which I am super grateful for. I did go to school during COVID which negatively impacted my overall experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Generally, most students are quite friendly, which I love. The only thing I don't like is that I have a horrible work-life balance. I guess I should have expected it being a student-athlete, but it's very difficult.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience overall! Great campus and local area! Great experience overall! Great campus and local area!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a UPenn undergraduate, I've had a great experience! The professors are incredible, and the community is supportive and vibrant. I do wish students could leave the dorms after one year, like before 2020, but otherwise, my experience has been amazing!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My experience at the University of Pennsylvania was incredible. I loved the academic opportunities, which offered both rigor and flexibility, allowing me to pursue a dual degree in Bioengineering and Business. The social life was vibrant and dynamic, with countless clubs, activities, and events fostering a strong sense of community. Most of all, I appreciated the amazing people I met—passionate, driven, and diverse individuals who inspired me every day.

If there’s one area for improvement, I’d like to see increased support for mental health and wellness resources to better address the challenges of a fast-paced environment. Overall, Penn was transformative and exceeded my expectations in many ways.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: There’s always an event going on and Penn has a really good way of organizing everything. There are so many open source tools available to make course registration club selection, club application and just living on campus really really easy. In addition the university is very clear with guidance as current events happen And they’re also very communicative sending out a newsletter every single day on what’s happening at Penn .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's an ideal school- lots of opportunities, you have the leeway to explore other majors when you come in as a freshman, amazing campus, understanding professors. You also have the opportunity to tailor your degree to cover a variety of academic interests, especially from the College of Arts and Sciences. The food is terrible though- not a lot of cultural representation in Penn cuisines served in the eateries.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with University of Pennsylvania has been a wonderful experience, thus far. I mean, I have a 3.4 cumulative and grade point average here. First of all, and it's the first-ever private and prestigious college that the one and only Benjamin Franklin built. I like the curriculum to my specific UPenn program of study second of all, which my major is creative writing. The classes are not hard to do when it's actually my passion. The professors are professional and relatable. I can relate to the fact that me and my professors have poetry and short stories published in literary journals. So there's that rare commonality. I would like to see a magical realism class within the college of liberal and professional studies sector.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Some professors can be a little unapproachable, but if you really want mentorship anywhere, you have to be prepared to seek it out. Lots of clubs and volunteer opportunities but exclusiveness has become a real issue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Financial aid for middle class students is terrible! Told at last minute that I am not eligible for financial aid!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university is full of inspiring minds who want to change the world. I appreciate the community fostered by the program and the networking it has offered post-graduation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a great place to be in college! There is something for every type (athlete to artist to stem lover to finance bro). The classes are intense yet professors are caring. Campus is in an area called university city, only 1.5 miles west of Philly: you can walk or trolley into the actual city to expand your experience. Campus is its own space that is mostly contained around locust walk. There are a lot of trees and nature despite being so close to a big city. The walk-only areas of locust and the bridge are quiet despite the university-city streets around the border.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Penn so far has been great, I’ve met tons of new people and enjoy the classes. It is difficult though and I can only say for my major, but taking the premed classes can sometimes be even more difficult. The professors are amazing though so if you’re having trouble, reach out! The one thing I’d change is the dining hall food because sometimes it’s pretty bad. There also needs to be a late night option because all the dining halls close very early currently.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my experience so far at the University of Pennsylvania. The campus is great and lively, students are actively involved in clubs, Greek life, and off campus organizations. I am involved in many activities and have met so many great people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience at UPenn so far. I enrolled in many classes as I want to complete a double degree in AI and Electrical Engineering, made friends with varied and very passionate people, and started doing research in quantum computing. I look forward with optimism!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I started my freshman with a broken leg due to an accident in my family house. On campus I struggled to make friends and could not work properly for most of my time, until I found a group of 3 students with which I became best friends. Now we work together all the time and go out for runs and they showed me all the beautiful places they've found. It's been only upwarsa since then
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I enjoy being at the University of Pennsylvania. The campus is beautiful and relatively safe. The staff is friendly, intellectual, and encourages creative thinking. In regard to academic programs, the University of Pennsylvania has world-renowned options, particularly in nursing and business (the Wharton school). One unique aspect of the University of Pennsylvania is its commitment to diverse populations and perspectives. Our freshman class this year has students from over 100 countries, bringing a variety of cultures and languages to the community at Penn. The University of Pennsylvania has a very selective admissions process but once accepted, the university is very welcoming and cares about the wellness of its students. The university has a very political atmosphere and can tend to relate narrow viewpoints related to political issues. There have also been recent protests related to political issues that brings a sense of insecurity and division to campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really liked the welcoming atmosphere of the campus. It’s nice that the RA’s are really nice and welcoming as well as the staff. Although, I’d say that it shouldn’t be advertised as “one big community” because it is a very cliquey, high school  dynamic. I say this because a lot of the people are extremely immature and rude.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Do not come to this school if you are not planning on being in Wharton.  Counciling/administration is incredibly unhelpful and makes it almost impossible to succeed, if you are not majoring in finance, entrepreneurship, econ, etc.  The atmosphere revolves around money and it is next to impossible to get anything done, as the school operates like a business--every aspect of it serves only to make it more money with complete disregard to student happiness/success (unless, as stated, said student is in Wharton or has parents willing to donate exorbitant amounts of money to the school).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I think that I’ve had a great time at Penn, better than I was expecting when applying for college. You meet people who will push you to be your best, which can be very beneficial, but also contributes to the mental health strain that’s pretty pervasive on campus.

Despite the pressure, you can still meet great people and invest a lot of time into things you care about.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Philly is a great area, you can ALWAYS find something to do. The food is fantastic, the sports atmosphere is great, I really can't complain about the area. The school itself is a healthy balance between being a challenge but not being too stressful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a really great first year at UPenn. I have been able to take all the classes I signed up for and dreamed of taking in high school. I received a free passport, am planning to go abroad, and have been able to double major with a minor. Campus life and opportunities are great as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: i think upenn offers so many things to undergraduates and what i really like is how they help newly admitted freshman transition into college. they offer multiple tutors and study sessions and it is good to take advantage of them
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I can't explain how thankful I am that I go to Penn. In just over a year I've made friends for life and I'm excited to see what the future holds. The classes are extremely interesting and prepare you for work, and on the other side of things the social scene at Penn always has something happening. The connections you get here are also insane as someone coming from completely outside of the business world. Go to Penn, trust me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being a student at the University of Pennsylvania was a life changing experience. I loved the classes I took as an environmental science major and the opportunities to join clubs and meet new people. There was always excitement on campus and events with free food. I think there could be improvement for free speech allowed on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like how available all the teachers are to help you success within the program. They always have things to offer like extra help understanding new topics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love that Penn gives you the best of both worlds. You can feel like you are in New York and go out on the town with your friends, but the campus is also very small and enclosed for that Gilmore Girls vibe. You get to meet so many cool people from all over in all of your classes. The social life offers so many unique opportunities for you to experiment and try new things.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like to see more effort across the board to make students of color feel not only accepted but welcomed. Otherwise, I can't complain too much, because I got to interact with amazing and supportive professors and incredible resources to aid my premed career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a hard place to be if you don't know what you want to do in life. Some people get lucky with advisors, but a lot of them simply don't care, and the funding is set up in a way that pits the different schools against one another, leading to structures that serve schools rather than students. However, there are many things to Penn's credit as well. Our academics in most programs, particularly engineering, anything related to the cognitive sciences, medicine, etc, are much more rigorous than anything you find at most schools, even some other Ivies, because there's more of an emphasis on theory in lectures than larger universities, but also a, large amount of practice involved since there's so much pre-professionalism and Ben Franklin founded the school. (Not always a fan of the pre-professionalism but that's a separate thing). Point being, there is both good and bad at Penn, but I find that Penn students generally multifaceted while being more pragmatic than elsewhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a student, my experience was flawless. The campus exuded a tranquil atmosphere with friendly individuals and exceptional professors. As an athlete, every aspect was fulfilling—from the dedicated coach and supportive teammates to the ideal environment for achieving one's goals. 

As a student, I found this area incredibly accommodating. It boasted an array of amenities like restaurants, supermarkets, pharmacies, a post office, housing options, parks, proximity to downtown, libraries, and other essential facilities crucial for student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Throughout my first year, I have been challenged academically to meet the standards and have been provided with resources to make it happen. The University of Pennsylvania ensures all students quickly realize their academic excellence.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's important to acknowledge that college experiences vary greatly from person to person, and while some may face challenges or difficulties, others may find their time in college to be transformative and rewarding. Instead of focusing on the negatives, perhaps you could consider exploring constructive criticism or discussing specific areas for improvement in the college experience. This approach allows for a more balanced and productive discussion that can lead to positive changes and improvements in the education system. If you have specific concerns about your college experience, it might be helpful to address them directly with the appropriate channels within your institution or seek support from counselors or advisors. Remember, challenges are a natural part of any educational journey, and there are often resources available to help navigate them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked UPenn and found it very academically enriching. I most enjoyed the academic culture of interdisciplinary study, which allowed me to study interdisciplinary studies like Philosophy, Politics, and Economics (PPE).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have greatly enjoyed my time at the University of Pennsylvania so far. I feel that the academic aspect of the school has been amazing, while also having an environment that has allowed me to meet amazing friends and peers. Overall, I think that Penn has the perfect work hard play hard balance and I am excited to continue my time here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the University of Pennsylvania was unique.  I started my program completely remotely in June 2020, at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic. My courses transition to hybrid, then to completely in person through the 18 month program. Much of the faculty was incredible. Clinical experiences were overall good. My experience there was mixed, as we were charged a regular tuition rate, despite having extremely limited access to facilities historically offered by this institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm so grateful to have spent four years at Penn, a school that gave me opportunities I couldn't have imagined possible before. I studied abroad in France twice. I recorded two albums with my a cappella group. I conducted research for my thesis in Los Angeles. I performed The Vagina Monologues in front of thousands of people. I published academic and creative work for journals, magazines, and one of Penn's libraries. I had unlimited access to free coffee at the most welcoming work-study job. In the same night, I pranced about on one stage as an 18th-century man and rocked out in a ball gown with a band on another stage in downtown Philadelphia. I met some of my best friends on the very first day of my freshman orientation. This was my Penn story from 2012 to 2016. The university looks a lot different for students today, especially in terms of feeling safe to practice their religion, protest peacefully, and voice concerns. I hope Penn prioritizes its students' well-being moving forward.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a senior studying communication at the University of Pennsylvania (UPenn). I have enjoyed my time here. Academically, UPenn is tough and I had to spend time in my first year purposefully adjusting to what was expected of me. I have learned a lot about topics I am interested in. There is a wide range of classes. Outside of class, there are some negatives at UPenn. I think the dining hall are bad. There are not enough options, and the dining halls are not open all the time, so you may not have time to go and have a meal when they are open. There are lots of clubs to join and there are always events going on, so there is always something to do. Philadelphia is a great city and it is easy to go into Center City from campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far, UPenn has been an amazing place to live out my college experience. There is definitely some imbalance between resources allocated to Wharton vs the other undergraduate colleges. I would also like to see more effort and funding being put into student resources, ie food, dorms, academic advising, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn was a great school for me. I went to Wharton for undergrad, majoring in economics and concentrating in finance and social impact. I liked the comprehensiveness of the core curriculum, as well as the breadth of elective options and relative freedom to customize your degree. The professors were for the most part stellar, curriculum really well designed, and administration very supportive of students. The campus is lively and student clubs aplenty. In terms of what I'd like to see change, I'd like to see more opportunity within on campus recruiting for more than just consulting and investment banking industries.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The classes and professors are amazing. Philly is not the best city in my opinion, but there are tons of things to do. The culture on campus is very career-oriented and somewhat competitive. Students are constantly stressed and sleep-deprived but also incredibly impressive people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I studied bioengineering and really enjoyed the community and education at Penn. There were many opportunities available and the program felt very collaborative and project-based which I enjoyed. Penn also has a really nice campus and it's very easy to get out and explore Philly.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a tough adjustment at first but the rewards after graduation speak for themselves. The reputation of the school name will carry you far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school, I was accepted to the Wharton program, it's a very driven school and social. There's alot to indulge in and have fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have a great experience with the faculty members. My advisor and all my professors have been very helpful for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn was a great place for me to study the majors I want. They offer lots of flexibility with the choice of courses for the majors I am pursuing. Furthermore, the campus is great, and Philadelphia is in proximity to multiple big cities on the east coast. Overall, UPenn is great, and I do not have much to offer for change.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I will begin to take courses and live at the University of Pennsylvania next year. I am not yet a student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is widely recognized for its prestigious standing, and I only fully grasped the extensive range of opportunities it offers once I became a part of this community. The diverse and global composition of the community, encompassing professors, friends, and staff, has enriched my learning experiences tremendously. Despite the myriad of opportunities, I do wish I had been more informed in advance about the academic demands at Penn. As a freshman, the courses I am currently enrolled in may be considered "easy" by many American peers, yet I find them to be quite challenging. This challenge can be traced back to my educational background in a non-English speaking public school in my home country, where I lacked exposure to rigorous coursework.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn is great because of all the opportunities that are available. Students in certain subject (STEM) are highly competitive. Sometime that can be really isolating. It’s good to find a community where you can be yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is renowned for its prestige, and I was unaware of the array of opportunities it provides until I arrived here. The diverse community, comprising individuals from around the globe—be it professors, friends, or staff—provides invaluable learning experiences. Despite the wonderful opportunities, I wish I had been aware beforehand of Penn's academic rigor. The classes I'm presently taking as a freshman are considered "easy" by many American peers, yet I find them challenging. This difficulty stems from my background in a non-English speaking public school back home, where I didn't have exposure to rigorous coursework.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a beautiful place that has a lot of opportunity. However, there are some downfalls. Firstly, there is an extremely prominent pre professional culture that creates at times a toxic environment. This also translates into club culture as many clubs relating to popular fields like consulting take small numbers of people. Same goes for many other clubs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Campus culture is very pre-professional. If you're not certain of yourself, get certain quick, and find your niche.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The food isn't very good. Very competitive in nature. Crime around Philly but campus is overall more safe than not.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: i haven't been technically accepted yet but I' pretty sure i'm getting in on the online program. I am looking to get a $12,000 scholarship which will cover my 4 pre degree classes I have to take to get admitted to the BA degree program.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The faculty here is incredibly supportive of whatever endeavors you wish to pursue. As a student who desired to double major, the Penn staff supported me. Most of the student body here double majors, so don't get too caught up in the "pre-professional" stereotype of Penn. It's there, but it could be worse.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn's campus is amazing, the scenery is very pretty, environment is nice. There are many people from around the world you can meet and talk to. It's a very diverse, welcoming school
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to Wharton Undergrad, class of ‘99, and graduate school through the College of General Studies (now College of Liberal & Professional Studies) and the Fels Institute of Government, class of ‘04 & ‘05. I had an amazing experience. As a Black man, I had a few unfortunate encounters, but my overall experience allowed me to thrive in the years after. I met great through my fraternity both social and professional. I got involved in performing arts and even started an organization that sought to give a voice to the unheard. I learned more about myself during this first four years. Then returning for three more years as a graduate student, I got a chance to dig a little deeper. My experience at PENN is the base of who I am today.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As expected of an Ivy school, the academic scene is rigorous. I really love my courses, but I do need a lot of time to prepare for exams, and there always papers or assignments due. Club scene is very competitive as well. 
The thing I like is the amount of beautiful buildings, how big the campus is and the fact that you will definitely be given as much financial aid as you need.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Every year I spent at this institution cut my lifespan short by 5 years. Every semester I spent here, at least one undergraduate student died by suicide. Think twice about coming here---it can break you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending the University of Pennsylvania has surely been enriching experience with plentiful opportunities to network, grow, and improve upon professional development. Although the resources are plentiful, they are not widely promoted enough to vastly reach all the students that can make use of them. It is a lot of seeking to find the resource you need. Although it is a private university with one of the largest endowments, financial aid is not sufficient as I expected. As I was struggling financially, I still had to pay a good amount of tuition. Joining a Greek organization is also expensive. Applications for clubs are immensely difficult. These things promote a gap between those who can afford and those who cannot and those who have had experiences and those who have not. Attending college is about learning and achieving more access, but this university lacks on that end. Some courses have a flip classroom learning style, which I would say is not why I'm attending college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although I’m only in my sophomore year, I have gotten a sense of what Penn is all about. There are lots of opportunities everywhere and the connections you make are one-of-a-kind. People seem to be very ambitious and there is definitely a pre-professional atmosphere. The school lives up to its “work hard, play hard” motto, but sometimes the social scene can be pretty exclusive. The food is also close to unbearable at times, which I hope they improve soon.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I admire the most about the University of Pennsylvania is the overall diversity in ideas, culture, and and people! Additionally I love the community and endless opportunities for internships, research programs, and academic aid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a a very diverse campus in which all cultures are represented. It is a competitive environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a University of Pennsylvania student, my experience has been transformative. The academic rigor and diverse courses allowed me to explore passions and develop critical thinking. Accessible and knowledgeable faculty shaped my journey, while the vibrant campus life fostered a sense of community among students from diverse backgrounds. I appreciate the emphasis on research opportunities, collaborating with renowned scholars, and Philadelphia's cultural scene, offering internships and networking.

However, addressing the cost of attendance with more financial aid options and scholarships is essential for equal access. Moreover, enhancing inclusivity and support for underrepresented groups would strengthen our community further. Overall, UPenn has provided exceptional opportunities, but improvements can make it an even more accessible and inclusive institution for all students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn has a great, diverse community of students, as well as great research facilities and resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The people I have met are absolutely wonderful, professors and students alike. It is a place that has helped me develop the social and engineering skills necessary in industry. However, it is a highly competitive environment, where students may at times work against one another, or exclude certain individuals if they are not at the same status. Therefore, UPenn has its advantages, such as the numerous opportunities it provides to its students, and disadvantages, such as the toxic environment it boasts. Of course, it depends on who you surround yourself with, but with the majority of people I have met, there is that underlying competitive nature.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania is a great school if you're looking to make connections in your respective field. The students are ambitious and often have clear goals with the drive to succeed. Coming here has opened me to job prospects and interests I would not have been exposed to otherwise. The downside to this intense atmosphere is that it can be mentally draining. There are plenty of good people but the cutthroat nature of the school can pit people together and prevents a more collaborative environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn has a beautiful campus, great facilities, and an exceptional student body and faculty. At Penn I had probably the best four years of my life, and made friends that will last a life time. I'm so grateful for all of the amazing opportunities the University of Pennsylvania provided to me. From guest speakers, to events, to career fairs, I couldn't have asked for a better place to go to college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing!!! I love how welcoming everyone at the school is. I honestly wouldn’t change a thing. I’ve felt so supported since admission.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great teachers and courses as well as a gorgeous campus. The student body can be a bit intense academically, but we have a great deal of school/city pride. Thus, I really love Penn's academics, the campus, and the students. However, I wouldn't say I like the administration and the dangers that occasionally pop up around campus sometimes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn has great academic flexibility and advising through the different colleges, and that is what immediately drew me to the school. I also enjoy their emphasis on community building through different houses and the freedom to explore classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the whole campus vibe, it was very walkable, had a late-back relaxed feel, and had great buildings. I loved the students, they are so kind, friendly, and compassionate, and so are the teachers. Also, there are plenty of opportunities to study what you want.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
While my experience at Penn has been overwhelmingly positive, there are areas that I believe could be improved. One aspect I would like to see change is a greater emphasis on mental health support and resources. College can be a challenging and stressful time for many students, and it is crucial that the university continues to prioritize the well-being of its students by expanding mental health services and promoting a culture of self-care and balance.
Additionally, I would love to see more efforts toward fostering inclusivity and diversity on campus. While Penn is home to a diverse student body, it is essential that the university continues to create an environment where all students feel seen, heard, and supported. This includes initiatives that promote diversity in the curriculum, increase the representation of marginalized voices, and provide resources for cultural understanding and dialogue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredible university with a great balance of world-class academics, strong pre-professional support, and a thriving social life! Also situated in a city with abundant internship, volunteer, and recreational opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The experience was generally good, though there could have been more support for students in showing and explaining how to take advantage of the resources available.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a very historic institution with a lot of resources but those resources are poorly advertised. Also the culture can be extremely unhealthy (e.g. the glorification of burnout)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: upenn is great school as you all know, however it is too expensive for everything. Food is meh and housing cost sky rocketed...
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: A bit of the rich party scene but overall diverse and met awesome people. The academics are rigorous, a lot of homework and a bunch of challenging professors but overall good classes (if you stay away from the math department)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience with UPENN has been wonderful. There is an amazing support system in this school where students and faculty will help you out. This university is also ranked the #1 school for nursing, and the opportunities here are limitless. If there is a specific research you are interested in, there is likely a professor who is already researching this topic. The networking system is insane given that this university is close by CHOP and UPENN Medicine. Highly suggest going here, but the tuition is really expensive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: a lot going on everyday; simultaneously overwhelming and exciting; very social/outgoing student body;
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania is pretty good overall but it definitely has some things to fix for the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fantastic university with world-class professors and lecturers. Features a great diversity of incredible students as well with people ranging from all over the world with a variety of interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Pennsylvania overall provides an academically enriched environment. My favorite class was Experimental Psychology, and my professor was especially welcoming and nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I came to Penn as an international student from Japan, and so far I'm loving it here! Here are some things about Penn that I truly find amazing:

The students are diverse. As a world-renowned Ivy League school, Penn takes students from all over the globe, with a variety of racial and gender identities, backgrounds, hobbies, and academic interests. When I meet new people here, they always blow my mind.

Opportunities are everywhere. Penn is a research institution with renowned researchers in just about every field imaginable, and the cool thing is, everyone can be found within one campus! This makes it possible to get involved with research of all sorts, including typically graduate-level fields like medicine, law, or dental medicine. 

Philadelphia is full of discoveries. Penn is situated near Philadelphia's Center City, a city with an amazingly rich history. I especially love the culture of volunteering and philanthropy here.

Penn may be hard to get in, but life here is phenomenal!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Education is superior.  The campus is extraordinary in a great city. It is very diverse.  Professors are excellent.  The students are all highly intelligent.  A competitive environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the University has been phenomenal. The professors I have spoken with, my advisors, even my RA have all been a wonderful help. The community the school builds is also very good, with help through every step, especially during the first couple of weeks of moving in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are the best part about the university. They take a real interest in the students and care about helping us achieve our goals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although I consider Penn to be a fantastic school in terms of academics and resource availability, there is a lot of things that Penn can do outside of the academic sphere to improve its overall rating. Penn, being one of the largest universities in the world and the number one employer in the city of Philadelphia, should be engaging more in corporate social responsibility projects to offset their negative impacts to social norms in the city. Penn is one of the greatest contributors to fossil fuel investments in Philadelphia and are displacing black facilities in West Philadelphia by increasing real estate prices through land acquisition. Being an academic institution doesn’t exempt one from working towards the betterment of the community it inhabits.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Upenn is a pretty great school. The campus is gorgeous, party scene is very fun and social life is intense for sure. People go out from Wednesday to Saturday every week. Dining hall food is not the best but it isn’t terrible and there are a lot of options. But the Math department sucks, worse department at penn by far
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university is amazing overall, the academics, programs and oportunities are top-notch. However; there are some things that could be improved, especially the food and the dorms, which so far haven't been too good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The caliber of academics of this institution is hard to beat. I admire the fact that they have an online education department, however something I would like to see changed is what is offered in this online department. For example, I want to enroll in their Psychology Minor program, but it's on-campus only, and relocating states is not an option for me right now. Another thing I'd like to see changed or worked on is the communication between schools/departments. They all seem to have conflicting information.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I transferred after one semester. As a student athlete, I felt as though I was not treated properly. I was told my autism didn't need accommodations, I was told I needed to go to class even though I was currently in cancer testing. The professors are not understanding at all, except for the select few. Also, heads up, the parties are another level. LSD has been offered at some of the parties I went to. Just be aware when looking here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn provides a lot of opportunities to pursue academic and nonacademic interests that set the students up for success!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have recently committed to UPenn for women's soccer. I have been welcomed with open arms. There has been clear communication on how to proceed with applying and seeking financial help. Inquiries are welcome and encouraged, so there is no room for confusion or misinformation. I feel joy and relief knowing I have the support and encouragement from UPenn to overcome the anxiety and doubts about moving away from home and starting my adult education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus and the teacher I had in the summer program. The overall feel, vibe, and environment of the University is incredible and stunning
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great for making connections. Huge variety of classes and flexibility in what you want to study. Many resources available for any interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I recently toured the campus of UPenn and spoke to an admissions officer regarding my interest in UPenn. I am very impressed with the university, the campus, the selection of majors, and the great medical program that it offers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like to see more efforts toward improving student life especially for the POC students in obtaining a dedicated building for them just as every other Ivy League institute has.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Top tier university in a west philly safe zone. Students from all over the world share a common work hard play hard mentality
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although competitive at times, UPenn offers students the ability to find a community that is both in the city and outside of it making it the best of both worlds. Additionally, with the wide range of opportunities available you can travel the world, and find something that you are truly passionate about. There are also no barrier to undergrad research starting as soon as freshman year which is a phenomenal opportunity for anyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a pretty good university! However, some downsides would be campus food and the grade deflation. It's a good university for those who want to work hard, play hard.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a place with lots of opportunities for people from all backgrounds and with all sorts of interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the community of friends that I met while attending the University of Pennsylvania and felt as though I learned so much during my time here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, an amazing school. Some professors can be a hit or miss, but so far, I had pretty good professors. They are very willing to help me whenever I need it and (for the most part) generous with extensions. UPenn also has a lot of cool resources so you don't feel like you're stuck doing nothing which is nice. Big party school, if that's your scene. Food is alright, I wouldn't complain to be honest, and the dorms for the most part are pretty average depending on where you live.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The environment is very competitive, but overall I think they do a pretty good job preparing you for your future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the people, my classmates, and the TAs. Some of the professors are really good others are just there for research. There isn't much to do in Philly, but the people you are with make it worthwhile. It is a sacrifice to attend this school but one that will pay off.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Known to be a prestigious school, but honestly sometimes doesn’t feel like that which is good. Just a very pre professional culture focused on internships and job after college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I had a great experience at Penn. Even though my program's management was lacking, everything else ran smoothly. I made great friends, learned from outstanding professors, and challenged myself academically.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my experience at UPenn, and I believe the school offers an abundant amount of opportunities including networking connections, professional aid, and more. The competitive nature of the school is very high, and it can be difficult at times to keep up, but checking which professors and classes are highly rated will open up what courses might interest you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school with great academics - Computer science courses are work-heavy, but you learn a lot in them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Many major universities in cities are so spread out, but Penn really has its own "universe" within the city, without being totally shut off. It is easy to access not only the Center City Philadelphia area, but for students who are not drivers, its an easy connection to explore the city and suburbs through public transportation, and even a short commute - by foot or bus - to neighboring universities and colleges. Philadelphia is a US city with a lot of great history and modern conveniences. Located between many of the major cities along the East Coast, the UPenn student has a multitude of opportunities to explore on long weekends. The University itself is rich with institutes and centers that are innovating and including undergraduates as well as graduate students and visiting scholars with opportunities to participate in and lead rich spaces of innovation, including the Pennovation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very generous need-based financial aid. Mental health services could IMPROVE a LOT. Many students feel lonely and abandoned.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university of Pennsylvania has allowed me to explore the field of criminology with amazing professors that have done excellent work in the field. I am glad that I have had the opportunity to engage in the academics of this school, however I do not think that I fit in with the social scene of this school. It is a very work hard/ play hard environment which can be uncomfortable for someone not involved in Greek life or drugs and alcohol.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was very impressed with my virtual course in finance. It was a summer immersion experience and my first inkling of college life. I would have preferred to be in-person but COVID restrictions altered my plans.  My first college choice is the University of Pennsylvania. It’s location and reputation are world renowned. My professor and course advisor were helpful .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Worst experience of my life. Came in as an injured athlete, received no help whatsoever when I wasn't mobile. I have autism, and they did no accommodations for me. I had to leave due to the issues I endured, going to a new school in the fall. Whatever you do, don't waste 80k on this school: it isn't worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's not for everyone. They need to fix the type of people they represent at its core, not with bandaids such as initiatives and resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Pennsylvania has been a great undergraduate experience for me. Transferring in, I immediately found the community I was looking for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Pretty racist college that tolerates racism and xenophobia against minorities. I wouldn’t trust the administration.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s a great place to study. Classes are rough (at least from my experience as a STEM major in an intense program) but ultimately rewarding. There’s a social scene for every type of person. There are infinitely many opportunities for academic and professional development. They are stingy with financial aid tho
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Work hard, play hard!  That’s life at Penn.  Strengths - Great approachable Professors,  almost any class or activity you can think of, wonderful diversity, beautiful campus.  Lots of opportunities to study abroad.  Greek life is active, but not necessary to have a rich social life.  Tuition, room and board are expensive but there’s lots of aid available.  Highly recommended, but very competitive admission rate (  around 8% ).  Suggest applying Early Decision if Penn’s your first choice ( 18% acceptance rate ).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have experienced several life-defining moments at the University of Pennsylvania (Penn) that I am sure I wouldn't have encountered anywhere else. During my college application process a few years ago, I wanted an institution that would be a good academic, financial, and social fit for me. Over my few years there, I have had moments that solidified for me that the school met (or at least attempted to meet) all of the three aforementioned criteria. My years at Penn haven't been completely rosy - what with catching the infamous "freshman plague," challenging classes, and considering several majors before finding my niche. However, I can safely say I will be walking away from the University with contacts of amazing professors and staff, and more importantly, lifelong friends who feel like family.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania is a school with great academics. The campus life is active and only a 25 minute walk from downtown Philadelphia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is in the middle of the city of Philadelphia which is a very cool city to live in (except some parts with safety risks), the professors and graduate students are great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best thing about Penn is definitely the people or the students. All students are motivated to do well, but also passionate about multiple interests. The amount of diversity you encounter is tremendous. It is the perfect blend of a campus life located in a city and the perfect example of a school with well-rounded students. Penn is also known for its research and professional resources. No matter what career you are considering Penn is the place to be. It is the school with the highest percentage of students with internships. There are numerous opportunities to get involved in research. One complaint might be that the culture is too pre-professional, but Penn has a great liberal arts program as well. It has some of the best programs in linguistics, psychology, and urban studies. Penn is a campus where innovation and research are encouraged and fulfilled. Furthermore, it is one of the best colleges in terms of engaging and serving the community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Extremely driven and balanced student population. Can go from hard-core talks about where the world is headed to partying on a dime.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Driven and hard working classmates. Everyone is passionate about their area of study. The classes are sometimes rigorous but help is always offered. The pressure to succeed is a little intense because everyone is very smart.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn offers an elite academic curriculum and a fun social scene on the best city-school campus around.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended Penn, undergraduate, business and medicine.  It is an awesome place.  Challenging, fun and supportive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I felt that there were many positives about Penn. Access to a supportive alumni network, great and bright students, and the vibrant Philadelphia community make it an excellent school. However, there are some drawbacks, like the pre-professional culture, that one should consider when applying.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is amazing! Everything is very nice and I have a very nice experience so far. I am very satisfied with everything.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics and amazing preprofessional resources. While Penn does offer mental health resources on campus, a lot of the student body is very stressed and suffers from imposter syndrome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus and great people. While the university is not always receptive to change, the students are very vocal and active in trying to implement positive changes in the school. Professors are all dedicated to their studies and passionate.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really liked the people I've met so far and the professors in the departments I am interested in. Wish dining hall had more options. The campus is also great no to big not too small and the area around the university is full of life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPENN is extremely awesome. The Professors and Students are great. It is a Student-Friendly atmosphere
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania is an amazing school with great research opportunities and invaluable connections to professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experiences with the University of Pennsylvania were overall positive. The breadth of academic choices available was incredible. I explored a variety of subjects and transferred internally mid-way through my undergraduate career to focus on a business degree at Wharton, with a computer science minor. The school emphasizes pre-professionalism, providing many resources for corporate career development but also placing a lot of pressure on the student body. The student climate was compettiive, and students often spent most of their time with their extracurricular groups. The older dorms (I did not live in any of the newer developments) needed to renovations, and were unhygenic and cramped.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a very diverse school that offers many programs, while encouraging all students to be leaders of their community. There are some insanely talented faculty members throughout many departments which makes it possible for your learning to be unique and engaging. However on the other side, there are many negative experiences that come from the social pressure to do well and be occupied all the time with either studying hard or being on the scene. It creates a very difficult and unbalanced student life for most, making it hard to adjust to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Penn, there are countless resources available to help students succeed and get the most out of their college experience. The faculty is there to support students in pursuing their dreams and interests, whatever they may be. Penn allows students to truly explore what they want to do and take creative liberty in forging their own path with excellent help along the way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have only completed my first semester at Penn, and it was remote, so I cannot speak for campus life, but my peers and professors have been great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the University of Pennsylvania. I got into a program that I was really interested and it is super helpful for me in getting into the professional degree that I want to go into after I graduate. To be honest, I was really scared to go to the city because I'm a beach girl, but online schooling, so I don't really know how to rate that yet.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn is an amazing school built for just about anyone. It offers a wide variety of classes to choose from. The students here are so nice and caring for one another as well as the teachers. I would totally recommend attending this university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great campus life, academics, and area for young people.  Could do better for diversity... "cultural centers" are a little embarrassing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is renown for its top business school, medical school,  engineering school, and nursing school. The combination of its many and large top ranked undergraduate and graduate programs gives its students access to resources that are not accessible to students of any other university to the same extent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the diversity at my school. I have met and gotten to know people from various ethnic, cultural, economic, and political backgrounds. This has allowed me to become more knowledgable about the diversity in people's experiences and perspectives. I also love the academics at Penn and there is a broad range of courses available to students of all interests. Here, they will have the opportunity to thoroughly explore and discover their passions while building lasting connections with other students and professor.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love this school, but Penn still has a lot of work to do regarding its relationship with the West Philadelphia and the greater Philly community. The education I receive at Penn is great and have been able to take classes with the top educators in their fields. The social life is great and I would say better than most top schools, but can definitely feel exclusionary at times. Those are my main thoughts on the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very competitive environment. Always have events going on, it's very easy to meet new people. People are friendly but they can be very cold, especially when  you are their competition.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a great institution on a beautiful and historic campus with fantastic and supportive professors, courses and students. The environment really encouraged students to grow and push themselves while enjoying their time and having fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Coming into college, I had high hopes for achievement, opportunity, and personal growth. I expected my transition to be smoother than a freshly paved road. However, It was not that easy. I spent a majority of my freshman year learning how to adapt to a unisex school environment on my own, a shift that took more of a toll on me more than I expected. I soon learned that I had a severe case of social anxiety and found networking and making friends to be extremely difficult. However, I found so many safe spaces on campus. Spaces where my social anxiety dissipated into thin air. Spaces where I could express my true identity without the fear of judgment. At times It was harder than others to find this comfort., especially in spaces that lacked cultural and academic diversity. I would often come across individuals who were explicitly   unaccepting of my culture and race, but I did not let these experiences deter or hider the personal introspection and growth that I want to achieve.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Challenging and fast-paced learning environment. High quality education. Competitive environment. Expect to grow personally, professionally, academically, and socially. Okay diversity. Poor mental health. University needs to work on mental health issue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a Proud Penn Alum, I can honestly say that my 4 years here were the most rewarding by far.  Rigorous studies and intense competition, but I  Met tons of students and friends who went on to successful professional careers and the extracurricular and social life cannot be beat.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Penn has a lot of great qualities — namely the fact that I've had the opportunity to learn from professors at the top of their fields. That experience has been unparalleled, and I'm very lucky. But I do think that Penn has an obligation to be more committed to their first-generation, low-income students. The wealth gaps at Penn are striking, and as a FGLI student myself, it can be overwhelming. It's been hard to see my peers who really struggle economically to have to return to unsafe or uncomfortable home situations when our spring semester went online because of the pandemic. Penn also has a responsibility to give back to the Philadelphia community, and I don't think they've always made the most ethical decisions as an institution. Penn is a great school, but it could benefit from being the benevolent force it wants its students to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great faculty, facilities, and classmates. Incredible institution with a diverse student body that exposes you to multiple viewpoints and provides a one of a kind experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had the best time at Penn. It was a wonderful place to learn and meet friends for life. You will not be disappointed if you attend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great time. Met loads of quality people and overall really enjoyed myself. Certainly not divorced from the problems that all prestigious universities have (lack of socioeconomic diversity, competitive atmosphere, corporate pipeline), but if you can find other spaces to exist in, you will be able to have a good time. Philly really adds to the Penn experience too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The UPenn experience varies extremely within the community. Some students feel as though they are drowning in work and assignments, while some seem to barely be troubled by anything outside of their class times. That being said, most professors are very understanding of this and will help you if you ever reach out to them. The campus is amazing, an excellent blend of city living, and standard college-campus feel in my opinion.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn was a thrilling and meaningful experience. The academics are strong, the faculty brilliant, and the campus is stunning. I especially enjoyed the English department and the Benjamin Franklin Scholars program. Resources are incredible too - always a good idea to familiarize yourself with them early on. Here I'd like to highlight the vibrant LGBTQ community/center and the gym Pottruck. The location is also great - it feels like a college environment yet is so close to all the amenities of the City of Philadelphia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a really great school with exceptional opportunities. The campus has an amazing feel because it is in the city, yet there is still a quad area with green grass and tress, creating a sense of community within the university. There are also lots of restaurant options because of access to the city, which creates a fun environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at UPenn was rewarding, educational, a struggle, but well worth it.  I feel that my experiences prepared me for life. The professors prep you for reality and a higher criteria than normal universities or college life. Financial hardship makes life difficult for any person that comes from a low-income family, Yet, UPenn helped me through my financial struggles to complete my BS.  I did not get to do all that I wanted, but I am blessed for all that I accomplished. I would encourage anyone that wanted a good education to attend UPenn.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: High tuition. Top notch staff, resources, networking and campus. Number 1 nursing school in the world for 5 years in a row.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Pennsylvania is a school full of driven, curious, and passionate students that want to change the world in whatever field they are in. The campus has students with all interests never afraid to show the world what they love.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had an incredible four years at UPenn.  It goes without saying that the faculty and campus resources are unmatched, but truly it's the student body that made my experience so fulfilling.  They come from all different backgrounds but are all similarly driven and curious, and it's a rare and wonderful opportunity to have four years to make friends in that setting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful, but the dorms had cockroach problems and we could not have food on the table/ bed. I feel that for the money you pay, you should get newer and cleaner dorms! Academics are great!! The local area is pretty and has a lot of things to do, but after months it can be a little bit boring! The food was not the best, but you can always get something on wawa. Upenn is a prestigious school and you will always received "credit" for going there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: After a two-year year intense search for the ideal school, we discovered that UPenn had the perfect balance between location, campus life, diversity, size, tradition, and academic opportunities. The energy on the campus is palpable from the very first moment you step onto Locust Walk. My son did a summer program at Penn and absolutely loved the experience. He will be starting in Fall 2020 and we are so excited for him.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing university with top-notch professors, instructors, and staff, which include many of the most brilliant and leading researchers in their respective fields. Very social student body that's really passionate about what they study and often times extremely engaged through multiple activities, clubs, or societies. People you can make friends with for life, who changed your life with new perspectives on how to innovate and make the world a better place to live.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is good college to go to. I think its size provides everyone with opportunity to find their people. But it is very difficult no matter what your major is.  A lot of classes are just harder than they really have to be. People tend to prioritize their grades of their mental and physical health, and it becomes a difficult habit to break.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Without a doubt one of the best colleges in the country. The professors are some of the most successful in their fields, the academics are challenging and engaging, and Philly is a great city to live in, with a ton of events to partake in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellence in academics, campus life, location, and diverse student body and faculty.  Best decision of my life was to attend Penn.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a really good school with a great social scene and engaging professors. Most students are really friendly and interesting. However, there's a lot of stress and pressure that comes with being a Penn student, so be prepared to struggle a bit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: In terms of academics, Penn is an excellent school. Philly is also a great place to live! However, this is a bit of a toxic aura surrounding Penn which can definitely be damaging to your mental health.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: UPenn is a fantastic school overall. For engineers however, would like to see more funding and rooms/space to support the growth of engineering clubs. I would also like to see the growth of majors such as mechanical engineering and the addition of classes with focus on other concentrations such as aerospace design, and more. Despite these things, UPenn has fantastic people. It is easy to get involved in extracurriculars, house duties/planning events, and more. UPenn definitely feels like a home to me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is overall a great university - you get a worthy return on your financial investment, if only simply in the prestige that comes with the name. But in addition, the offerings of the university in terms of courses, research opportunities, student involvement, and various opportunities are more than abundant. Student life can be tough and competitive - it is highly pre-professional - and even at a top-ranked university, the poor professors outnumber the fantastic ones.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is blessed with great diversity.  Students are serious about their studies.  There is a wide range of activities available.  The campus is beautiful, and surprisingly walkable.  Students can take courses in any of the four undergraduate schools, no matter their major.  Professors teach classes, not TA’s, and are committed to teaching and available in their offices.  Scholarship money, based on need, is readily available.  In summary, a world class institution without snobbery.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A true research institution, the University of Pennsylvania encourages all of its students to be curious about the world. Fund their research, it provides once in a lifetime opportunities with access to remarkable faculty, an international reach, and trail blazing peers. As a member of the Ivy League, it connects its study body to similar-minded students in a culture of alma matter pride, playful rivalry, and inter-school dependent  programming. Whether it be an Ivy League conference on LatinX heritage, political science, or veganism, the University of Pennsylvania encourages curiosity at every seam of the institution’s fabric.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a great place. It's a school that has lots of opportunity and a great community. In my first semester alone I have made so many friends that love and support me. My experience has truly exceeded my expectations both academically and socially. This is largely because I am not afraid to ask for help when I need it. One challenge that students at Penn face is that its so big that you will not be helped unless you yourself go out and ask for it. There are plenty of resources available to students who want help (ie. there are academic resources and mental health resources), but if you don't ask for them or seek them out, you won't be helped. Overall, I'm so grateful that I attend Penn and I wouldn't transfer anywhere else for the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania is one of the best universites in the United States. It's challenging, but hard work pays off. The professors are understanding and are willing to help anyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that University of Pennsylvania encourages girls to be in STEM. I was a part of the Penn LENS Program and I attended the GAINS conference. I got a chance to meet women who worked in STEM field and gained experience in real laboratory while learning about neuroscience, robotics, computer programming and more. University of Pennsylvania gives opportunities to get involved in science. Everybody was welcoming and supportive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was a recruited athlete at Penn. I knew this school was the one for me immediately when I visited, and it stills holds true to this day.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I felt as if, I can redo college experience all over again, I would. Everything was amazing, from learning with your Professor to the food and housing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent University, you will learn a lot here. Be prepared for a hefty price tag. You can get anything you want or need in the University City area, as long as you can afford to pay or it. Philadelphia is a great city to live and learn in. UPenn is an ivy-league school offering world-class education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are numerous reasons that I love this university over other universities. One of them being is't diversity and willingness to accept talented students. As a person who is pursuing a career in business, University of Pennsylvania is the best choice for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am really fond of this university. It's very big, and I love how the college basically owns everything.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I attended the University of Pennsylvania as an exchange student during the 2017-2018 academic year. It is one of the most meaningful years of my time as a college undergraduate. I want to cite three reasons why I consider UPenn a very good university; its location and campus, its resources and extracurricular, and its prestigious academic atmosphere.

UPenn is located in Philadelphia, a city with a lot to do, whether the goal is leisure and entertainment or career advancement and research for a project. But the campus itself is beautiful and busy enough to trap you. There is always something going on, especially if you commit to activities and clubs that interest you. And lastly, everything from your classmates to the professor bring alive that feeling that gives UPenn its cannon as an Ivy League; beyond academic excellence, its people are friendly, intellectually curious, driven, and serviceable, willing to share their passions and desire to grow with others.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wonderful students, faculty, and administrators. Things can be expensive and sometimes they charge you for petty things, but overall positive expereince.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is an excellent school with brilliant students and great faculty. The campus is fairly compact, and it is breathtakingly beautiful. I would recommend Penn to any student who likes an urban vibe and wants to earn a degree with great connections in a pre-professional atmosphere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Pennsylvania has it all.  From Academics to social life, there is never a boring moment.  I recently spent my summer there and had the time of my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Penn is a very smart institution. A lot of people feel Imposter Syndrome, and it's especially hard if you're coming from a "hard" school and fought for going to an Ivy League only to think that you're not smart enough. It takes a while to adjust, but I think most people keep their head above water (thanks to good friends, occasional therapists visits, and a lot of motivation).

The hardest part about Penn is its pre-professionalism, which can become tiring. There are engineers boasting about the 100k they're going to get post-graduating, Whartonites focused on how they're going to end up on Wall Street, pre-meds planning for three majors and getting lost in their coursework; it's easy to feel inadequate. Sometimes this acts as a motivator to apply for jobs or internships, but sometimes it does a blow to your self-esteem.

Going to a hard college means it's going to be hard. For me, it was worth it. Throwing yourself off the deep end is a huge change, and maybe, a good one.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like the balance of academia and social life at the University of Pennsylvania. The campus is very active and alive, even during finals week.
