Very pre-professional and research oriented. I wish the financial aid offers were better, for I am struggling to finance my education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the history of the university and the diversity of the education. One of my favorite things is being able to easily take classes from all four undergraduate schools and be able to interact with students from all different interests and backgrounds. I would like to see Penn become more affordable for all students and provide less advantages for those with overwhelming wealth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Penn has been excellent. The professors are passionate about the content of their courses and make time to support their students if they need extra help. I have learned so much, from increasing my vocabulary to more nuanced perspectives on things I have studied in the past.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Definitely a campus-feel with the benefits of living in a city.  Lots of opportunity to take interdisciplinary classes and explore new subjects.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a truly inspiring place, and it was a joy to study there. Students tend to find the academics rigorous, but if you're willing to work then you will do well. Professors are fantastic, and they are all open to working with students one-on-one when concepts aren't clicking or if something in class piqued your interest. I loved my experience so much I'm going back for law school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: entering my freshman year, so far everyone is super helpful and friendly.  Very excited to start my freshman year there and play softball.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I thoroughly enjoyed the social experience and setting at Penn. I found that the academics were extremely challenging and the professors were not very willing to work with their students. Also,  as a student athlete I was frequently looked down upon in comparison to my peers, by my professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great first-year experience at the University of Pennsylvania, as the academics were challenging yet rewarding and the people were incredible. As expected, the dining hall food was average at best but I found the dorms to be better than I expected.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: U Penn definitely has a pre-professional culture, even if you're not in Wharton (the business school). That can affect people in different ways. The competition can motivate you or it can over-stress and burn you out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the sense of community and school environment! I run for Penn's cross country and track & field teams, and I was easily able to manage my time between athletics and school. Also, being a nursing major, I can see why Penn's Nursing School is #1 in the nation. It feels amazing to go to class everyday and be taught by the best of the best!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn continues to go beyond in its endeavors as a university. I am constantly in awe at how thought out and how well run everything is. So many support programs are available, new buildings and programs are always being announced. Socially there's something for everyone and not just something but for every type of person, there is a strong and rich group of people to be around. Obviously, Penn is one of the most elite academic and intellectual institutions in the world, and there are so so so many opportunities for involvement be it on campus (clubs, groups, etc.) or professionally with recruiting or study abroad, what have you. Ivy League athletics are also really great, something that hasn't been really spoken to. Plus, the school is in Philadelphia. The perfect school exists, and it's Penn.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's an okay school but has issues with diversity and poor housing. The grading system is overly harsh compared to other schools.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: In the heart of Philadelphia, Penn offers a first-class, immersive Ivy League education that moves away from the image of high scholar of other prestigious institutions, and instead values working with students in order to foster success. As a student in liberal arts, I have learned to bring an open mind to all the different kinds of courses I take, and have been able to bring an interdisciplinary view to my major through my classes, my relationships with my professors, and the overall atmosphere of campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Was a student at GSE from 05'-07'. Had some very stressful courses, but the professors were all very passionate and helpful. Classmates were very diverse and came from various backgrounds. Stays in Samson East and the rooms were terrible. Beautiful campus and tons of resources. Made some lifelong friendships and unforgettable memories.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience academically and socially. I met great friends and learned under (mostly) engaging and passionate professors. I enjoyed the location of the school as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wonderful scholarly atmosphere, world class professors, access to many clubs and resources such as career services, tutors, mental health, and much more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn connects you to opportunities that you would never even imagine because of the incredible faculty and access to resources in Philadelphia and beyond. I have had some amazing faculty advisors who have worked with me individually to reach my goals. The students are also so kind and welcoming and incredibly smart and motivated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Penn is a good school if you like urban-ness. It is also good for independent people as it really is a place where you have to learn to thrive. Make sure to take some good mental health practices as people tend to over-work themselves. If you work hard, you play hard, but both can be exhausting so also take time for yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The amount of opportunities offered by UPenn is tremendous. The campus looks good. Philly is also a good place to visit.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and peaceful: green lawns, trees, brick buildings and walkways, and statues. The food on campus is pretty good, and there are plenty of restaurants and cafes to choose from. Your experience at the University of Pennsylvania will absolutely depend on the school and department you attend. From my experience, the administrative side of attending the school is challenging at times. Financial aid doesn't always alert students to new processes prior to them occurring, causing confusion and delays in refunds. I did receive a generous grant from the school, so that was a huge plus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Enjoyable experience so far. Good professors/academics and vibrant social scene. Be wary of the pre-professional culture, but all around great experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: it's amazing and i really really really love it here. its been my dream school since i was a young child and to be able to go here is so amazing and such a blessing. studying psychology at upenn is really awesome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The education at Penn is world class and provides you with the tools you need for success in the future. However, Penn is also a very challenging place both socially and academically, so make sure you are prepared. Greek life also is a bigger part of social life than is advertised and definitely surprised me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: During my time at Penn I have grown both as an academic and an individual. I have been challenged like never before in my time management, studying skills, and abilities to adapt to new ways of thinking. The professors present their individual subjects with a desire to create change and better that field. Socially, the environment is competitive but I have encountered many peers who are eager to collaborate and help one another succeed. The surrounding area and the city of Philadelphia encourage adventure, and even on campus there is no shortage of activities on any given day of the week because of the boundless events and clubs. Students at Penn have limitless opportunities to discover and cultivate their interests through the engaging academia and diverse, friendly community of students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I truly love the University of Pennsylvania. I had an amazing time here and look forward to getting my graduate degree here next year. The highly professional environment and competitive atmosphere pushes students to reach their highest potential and grow beyond it. Penn also encourages students to have balanced social lives, and provides the students with the necessary resources to have their interests be represented within campus and in student groups. However, I must admit that Penn's hyper-competitive environment  does have drawbacks, especially on students' mental health. I think Penn could tackle this by changing their grading scheme, especially for underclassmen.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience is with the Graduate School of Education.  The GSE has faculty doing cutting-edge work, but they give little attention to their teaching in my program.  The Penn library is superb.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I hope to attend the University of Pennsylvania. I love it. It has a great Finance program at the Wharton School.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it here. When I first visited I felt immediately at peace. I love the safe, beautiful campus in the middle of an awesome city. Every day I'm here I feel I'm developing more as a person. Awesome art, great libraries, kind students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: University of Pennsylvania offers a very distant campus with low maintenance upkeep and overall low student agenda. My experience with this university has been poor for the most part the staff for university are very carefree when it comes to my well-being as a student. Do not recommend this university for any subject other than medical.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Student%20Life.Review: variety of social, professional, and service greek organizations and combinations of the three
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: won the ivy league for football during last season
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has a definite presence at my school, but plenty of people do not participate as well. Non-Greeks do not really think differently about Greeks, since everyone here is clearly intelligent and unique or else they would not have gotten in
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's there if you want it, people attend Homecoming and Penn-Princeton, but not much else. People also go to support their friends, but it is not a big school for college athletics. Although, Penn Relays is really cool and unique.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a sorority/fraternity for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are prevalent but not the focus of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Racially the student body is not exceptionally diverse but I have met a lot of international students
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not part of Greek life, but I do go to the parties thrown by frats
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about sports here at Penn to be honest
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about Greek life because it is for the undergrads but I do know that they parties are very popular. There are traditional Ivy League fraternities and sororities who get great historical housing and other benefits.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are a very big part of campus life and they are successful
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Ethnically/racially it is very diverse. In terms of economic background it is not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Being a non-greek, I only appreciate it for the parties they throw.. but even then, I didn't really go much after second semester of freshman year. Especially for women, the greek life promotes cliques and female-female competition. The way most, but not all, sororities are picked is through where you're from, who your family is, money, and physical attractiveness. People seem to be obsessed with what greek group you're in. I've been visibly looked down on when I get asked and say I'm unaffiliated, even by guys trying to hit on me. Despite this, there are some business, service, and cultural frats that seem great. The Panhellenic system is to blame here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Even at the homecoming game, most of the people there are freshmen and parents. Even then people only stay for 30 minutes or so
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty big on campus; about 40-50% of students are in Greek organizations. I am not part of Greek life, and I have a somewhat negative view towards it. It greatly affects the social atmosphere on campus and creates cliques. The organizations are not very diverse as I have heard that they choose members based on appearance during the rushing process. Many organizations seems very superficial and snobby, and only want a certain type of people to join.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are not that big of a deal at my school. While athletes are recruited, the school's teams are not the best. There typically isn't a huge student turnout at games, which may be a result of a lack of school spirit. School spirit is represented more in academic and professional fields than in athletics. Many people do not have time to participate in club and intramural sports, and would rather spend their time doing other activities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are people from many backgrounds, religions, ethnicities, and nationalities at the school. However, many of them might come from similar experiences, like their parents are doctors or lawyers. Socio-economic diversity needs improvement, particularly on a social level, but as a high-need student I feel like the administration supports me well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I honestly don't know anything about the athletics on campus. The student  gym is really nice though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life adds to the social atmosphere of campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fan support is lacking but the sports program is fairly good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really know much about the Greek life on campus, so I am not the best person to speak about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: People attend athletic events, but the school's reputation revolves around academic achievement.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are very good I like them a lot for many reasons
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I don't see the Greek life being huge here. There is definitely a presence, but it isn't an overwhelming one. I have never experienced any tension between non-Greek students and Greek students. All is good!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I have no opinion on Greek life. It's great if you are in it. It's fine if you are not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: In general, the athletics are not what the students come here for.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: not in it but a lot of my friends are and they seem to love it - i don't feel left out because i'm not in it though
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The teams do well and have a great community and there is great camaraderie among athletes, but athletics aren't a huge deal on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It seems good but I know nothing about it.  There isn't much school spirit except maybe at Homecoming
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's probably great for Greek life because it's very present culturally and even in the architecture (frats on Locust Walk), but it can be alienating for people who don't party
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are good here. Not many people go to games though besides football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of people rushed, but not many actually joined sororities. There are more guys in frats. I think the sororities on campus, and in general, are quite superficial. You will be able to find a group that you want, whether that is greek or not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity on campus is great, there are students from all 50 states as well as from nearly 100 countries. I have met students of various cultures and religious backgrounds. Integration, however, could be better as often times minority groups tend to self-segregate and keep to themselves because of fear of not being accepted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life, even multicultural greek life, is extremely vibrant here at Penn. There are a number of fraternities and sororities that cater to the diverse student body here, including co-ed greek organizations, historically black/latino/asian greek organizations, and also law/business greek organizations. There is something for everyone who may be interested.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Penn competes in the the Ivy League athletic conference which is not the SEC or the Big Ten but the games are fun to watch, and I enjoy going out and watching my friends and classmates compete for our school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Incredibly difficult to get into the most prestigious frats
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The sports teams are not really paid much attention.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Club sports and intramural sports are really fun. People don't really go to that many varsity games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a part of Greek life, but it seems that people who join a fraternity/sorority tend to enjoy it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are not as popular as they have been in the past. Some of the varsity sports teams are successful and occasionally people will attend games, but school spirit is not a priority when it comes to sporting events. Facilities, however, are quite nice and have recently been updated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm involved in Greek life on campus and I've had an amazing experience. It's not for everyone, but I've made lifelong friendships and college would not be the same without my fraternity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I personally love our football and basketball teams, but most students couldn't care less about sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about greek life on campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Again there are still issues with integration here but as a member of a sorority on campus it has given me many opportunities to network and experience new things and people but it is not social suicide if you don't join
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I mean you come to Penn for school not football, its never really been a factor for me in deciding my opinions on my school but alot of traditions that the school has revolve around the Homecoming game, i think thats the extent of sports hype here
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not particularly involved, but my classmates are part of teams, and there is some attendance to sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not a part of Greek life, but there are certain frats or sororities that think they're above everyone else, which can get annoying. Each Greek organization has its own reputation on campus and that feeds into the feeling of being superior or inferior to others around campus. The parties are usually good, and as a non-Greek you can get in as long as you know someone and have a high girl:guy ratio.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The teams here are comprised of some of the best athletes in the country. The football won the Ivy League with a new coach in his first year, so there are signs of great things to come under the new reign. The heavyweight and women's rowing teams both made coaching changes, and they seem to have been the right decisions as both teams are progressing well with respect to previous years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has a pretty strong effect on the social atmosphere of campus. A lot of the social events and crowds you surround yourself in revolve around parties and events. School is already a pretty small campus, so the Greek community is relatively tight-knit with each other. Although one does not have to be a part of Greek life to have fun, one would be able to have more relationships and opportunities to meet more people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The academic rigor that the student-athletes have to keep up with along with their athletic responsibilities is challenging. However, every student-athlete that I have met is very disciplined and gives their 100% in everything. You can tell their decision to go to college to play a sport and get a good education exhibits their strong character and spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am currently a freshman and rushing the fraternities at Penn is socially rewarding and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a student who doesn't participate in any Varsity sports, they aren't a big part of my life. However, I will go to games to support my friends who are on the team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Penn is so diverse I have been here one term so far and have met at least 4/5 people from each continent. Also, they are so friendly. The staff is diverse too and there are open groups discussing LGBT, religion and race. I have met people from diverse economic background so I would really rate Penn highly on such integration. 

Acceptance is very high. Am actually a member of a christian prayer group but most people are from different religions and they go to different churches on Sunday - and that's acceptable. 

There is open talk about current political situations... and people are very honest about their opinions (It's not ''weird'' talking about politics - Even though I haven't seen die-hard political groups promoting their agendas
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The students at this school have school spirit and do attend athletic events, but they are not the most important thing to students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Won't know much about it
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Football is a huge part of the college culture. Other sports like baseball, soccer, cricket, lacrosse are also popular
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Penn has a very diverse student body. I have met and befriended people from all over the world which is pretty cool. I don't think that Penn is very economically diverse. I think that most students are from upper middle/upper classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am personally non greek... I haven't got any setbacks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Very engaging.. Events are so well advertised on campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about Greek life, but I know that rushing is a huge event during the spring semester. Greeks often host parties and many varsity athletes participate in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a varsity soccer player at Penn. Athletes from different sports tend to be very friendly with one another. Our football team just won the Ivy League Championship.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The rush process is hard
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I really love how supportive everyone is. And its great that the faculty make the games affordable to everyone
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everything dealing with sports is fine as far as many students are concerned.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think that their main goal is to make sure that we are safe. Other than that, they allow us to have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Some people attend sporting events and theyre usually fun if you go, but most people dont pay attention.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Im involved in greek life and its fun but there definitely isnt pressure to join.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Its as strict as you would expect. If youre making a scene, you may get in trouble, but if you mind your own business its fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I don't think there is that much strictness at my school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They could be more strict when it comes to underage drinking. They are really not that strict in general.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: RAs and GAs in the freshmen dorms are far to quick to break things up/get kids in trouble for things playing music in the dorm, even before quiet hours begin.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Penn is very strict about plagiarism, more so than I've ever seen at any other school. In terms of alcohol/drug use, it isn't tolerated, but if a student is having an emergency response to drugs/alcohol, no one will be punished for getting them the medical help they need.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I don't live on campus, so I'm not sure how it is. However, the administration often does not seem to care about the students concerns and only those of the donors and their own wallet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is great on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: While they are very lenient in most policies, there are times when college students know no better. I have personally seen the drug culture take numerous lives from either overdose, or post use depression, leading to suicide. While that is not entirely the administration's fault, a more strict drug policy might curb some of the rampant hard drug (not marijuana or alcohol) use on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Don't really know much about it
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They throw all the parties, but aside from that there isn't a heavy atmosphere of it
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The sports teams aren't the best, but campus supports them. However, sports aren't the biggest thing on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Administration is nice and cares about students safety while not being too strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: While the administration sometimes gets a bad rap, overall they are there to promote a great student experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek system is there if you want it, not there if you don't. Greek life is a large presence in the social scene, but there are tons of alternate options for students who don't want to become a part of it. For example, many extracurricular activity groups have parties and events that are just as, and even more prevalent than Greek events. That being said, should a student want to join Greek life there's almost definitely a place where they will fit in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Nothing like a state school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about sports like at all
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: This year, Penn athletics have been pretty terrible as a whole.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Recently, the university has been shutting down parties en masse, which is irritating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As long as you aren't super loud pregaming with your friends, you won't get in trouble for alcohol in the dorms. Same with weed, just open a window and you will be fine. Administration is pretty chill.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Teams aren't great. Also almost no one goes to the football games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse student body; however, you're not going to see the diversity if you stick with one kind of activity (like only Greek life for example) so try new things!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity athletics are currently in a slump in terms of attendance. However, there are tons of options for club and IM sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Police officers are there to protect rather than to get you in trouble, and they are all very friendly and helpful. In the rare occasion that something serious happens, they respond swiftly and adeptly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of variety in the types of people you meet
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life adds a vibrant and fun dynamic to the campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students are pretty free to do as they please, as long as they are respectful to others around them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: None of our sports teams are successful, therefore, there isn't much support from the student body. However, faculty and the coaches are great. The only good team is the fencing team, however, we don't get much support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Student life is pretty segregated. The segregation isn't so much by class or race by choice. But, rather the segregation is by interest/social life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is present on campus but it isn't too big
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is very diverse but people from different groups don't interact as often as they should. College is a lot like high school in that way
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We definitely have an attractive campus but not much variety (i.e lots of preppy)
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Really nice friendly students, very diverse supportive community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse campus in every way. Very supportive of LGBT community also.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Penn students are treated like responsible adults by the administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of club options. The varsity athletes work really hard and take it very seriously. It is hard to be a varsity athlete as Penn is a challenging school academically so everyone has a lot of respect for them, juggling grades and training.  Penn is very supportive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks are super friendly, it is hard to get in because there are limits to numbers and Penn is a big school so a lot of students apply.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Its presence is definitely felt on campus, but I'm not part of one and still feel like there's so much to do. A lot of people you meet will be in a sorority or a frat and you can still go to events through knowing them, but you honestly just choose whether or not that lifestyle fits most comfortably with you. Housing is usually run-down (at least perceived as this) from the outside and for the ones off campus. Some on-campus ones are really nice on Locust Walk but other than that the houses aren't great looking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Overall the people at Penn are great to be around. Definitely a party environment, but counteracted with a hard working environment as well (work hard, play hard motto exists). For the most part outgoing and nice, as a whole Penn is a very active campus even if you're not on a sports team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Policies are for the most part average. I wouldn't say they limit or restrict the student too much -- average restrictions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Though in Division I, our sports teams don't garner too much attention or spirit from the student body unless you are directly involved or affiliated with someone on the team. I can think of Penn Relays as being one of the biggest sports events held on campus. The football or basketball teams are both just okay. Athletic facilities are amazing, love our gym.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Super diverse and lively -- different cultures are apparent on our campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: everyone is very down to earth and friendly at Calu
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: athletic sports especially football makes campus life more exciting and fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: You have to pay  a membership fee if you are a grad student but they have golf and classes
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't that huge, but most of the parties are thrown by fraternities, especially the parties that freshmen go to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone likes to be involved with their extracurriculars.  Also, everyone is really social and the scene for that is actually great at Penn.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People lack school spirit for the most part except for particular events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most students are very inclusive and accepting of those different from them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at Upenn is bigger than many expect, and being in a frat myself I would not trade the experience for anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A very interesting mix of people at the school allows you to meet new people every day.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Penn is such a big campus that it's really hard to meet people. If you aren't involved in tons of extracurriculars and organizations, you probably won't meet that many people. There are so many activities to choose from and they all require such a large time commitment that it's incredibly difficult to do everything you want to do and still pass your classes. It's very easy to get involved in an organization only to discover you don't actually want to do it, and there's a whole semester or year wasted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is plenty of diversity on campus, but you find that a lot of people come from the same socioeconomic background.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus has Sampson house where most of the Greeks people generally stay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As an Ivy league, it's expected that there are a lot of rich white kids, but there's also a fairly diverse mix.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not as huge as with big Southern state schools, but Greek life is the center of the party scene. On the other hand, there are lots of people who don't join who still go to the parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not very many people pay attention to athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think there's less of a divide at Penn between people in frats and sororities and people who aren't because even though some of the stereotypes still exist, most of the students at Penn are smart and motivated and obviously educated, meaning that the stereotypes are less evident. Having never thought I would ever join a sorority or have friends in sororities, I was surprised by how many girls I really liked who also happened to be in sororities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: A very diverse place. Unless you join interest-based groups rather than cultural or religious or even "social" based groups, it might seem like the diversity of the school is still segregated, but once you join a choir or club you can become friends with all different kinds of interesting people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: For an undergraduate campus, the level of strictness is relatively average.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are many places for physical activity which is a great resource!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is very diverse and there are buildings, clubs, and events for various ethnicities, religions (even a secular and pagan club), political parties, and the LGBTQ community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A bigger deal than you would think.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics aren't bad, it's more a lack of school spirit concerning athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: It's not very strict at all, but I find this to be beneficial and allows students to develop more independence.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Never did I think as a white Christian that I would feel like the minority, so the diversity here is humbling and impressive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very predominant on campus, providing a lot of social options for students on the weekends and an improved emphasis on community service in recent years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone here is beautiful by typical standards. People generally have finesse in their fashion. Everyone has a certain depth in personality and interest.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not too little, but not too much as well. If you really want to do something you can (except starting your own club, that won't happen).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People can be pretty normal, but it's still pretty common to meet a preppy "who are you to be talking to me" type of person.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Asian, jewish, and wealthy - the three words I'd pick if I had to describe the student population. The school tries hard to talk up their diversity, but don't be fooled. Like many schools, Asians are abundant, but there are also an incredibly large number of wealthy jews, most of whom have come to this school holding their legacy status. Most of the international students are very wealthy, and the "minorities" the school admits to fulfill their quotas also tend to come from very wealthy families.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I didn't join a fraternity because I'm not interested in that type of experience, but for those who are interested, it's easy to get on board. A word of caution, many of the fraternities lack diversity and are composed mostly of Jewish students who are not very welcoming towards others. Do your research on fraternities beforehand if that is very important to you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity is a major area of improvement on our campus.  As an IVY LEAGUE school we are mostly jewish and Asian.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Campus security for dorm access is strict and I am glad it is.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a freshman I am not familiar with Greek life except for the few houses in the center of campus.  I know Greeks and they seem ok.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone dresses well.  Some are even fashion experts.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Penn supplies the fraternities and sororities with a certain amount of money so they can attract the new students into the frat/sorority housing. Some are pretty high end- it is the Ivy League, some of these kids didn't get in on merit- and some are relatively low key.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Excellent, just right. But drugs (weed) could be controlled better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Overall great, relationships not always priority for students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Attendance in games is not popular. The opportunities are excellent... Ivy League frame.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The cultural diversity is superb, but the economic diversity is definitely lacking. There are a lot of kids from old money and a lot on full scholarships, but there's not too many in between. Luckily though, economic background is not as large of a barrier as one might expect.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is so diverse with different beliefs, opinions, and personalities that a wide variety of people can love it here. In other words, the introverted person can be just as happy as the big partier; there is seemingly a niche for all. All of the religious communities are very visible, yet they don't run the campus as they may at a more conservative school. The student body is liberally-oriented when it comes to politics, but there are plenty of conservatives, too, as well as those who simply don't give a rip. Despite the ease of finding a niche, one also invariably meets people of different views and interacts with them every day, whether in social or academic circles. Overall, the diversity at UPenn is a great asset to a top-notch education.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are many different religiona and races at Penn.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are many different types of students from ethnicity groups, sexually orientation, social backgrounds and religions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The strictness is pretty average for schools.  Safety issues are pretty strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: All city or suburban kids. Lots of Asians. Upenn is nerdy - what did you expect? People are fun to hang out with, but the hot guys are in limited supply.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Penn maintains a decent police force to escort people after-hours, but the wait time for such services varies. Overall, due to Philadelphia's past problems with campus security, it has really tried to step up its police force.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Although diversity is valued, many of the international students are socioeconomically in the higher ranks. In fact, most kids are on upper economic levels. Racially there is diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Overall, there are so many types of backgrounds (religious, and racial and socioeconomic) that there is never an end of diversity/acceptance. LGBT Center's great too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Penn is one of the most diverse campuses you can ever belong to! As a student, your classmates and friends will be of all races, ethnicities, religions, and sexual orientations. They'll open up your mind and you'll have a greater understanding of the differing peoples of the world. Penn is very welcoming regardless of however you identify yourself--you'll find small cultural communities to belong to and larger ones too. Many students might be first generation Americans, and many are international students. Some international students are the first ones from their country to ever come to Penn. Diversity is a very positive thing on campus, and people really respect others who come from unique backgrounds. No one will ever feel like an outsider at Penn-- if for some reason you do, chances are there are others who feel the same, and you can form your own activist group to change that. The student body is always mobilizing to make changes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You can find a diverse group of people at UPenn and thats what I love about it so much. Not everyone dresses the same way - everyone has their own sense of style. However a majority of the girls, I would say, dress very nicely (rarely bummy clothing such as sweats or hoodies except midterms/finals week). Guys, in general, wear normal clothing such as jeans and a t shirt or shorts and a tee or even just their work out clothes. However, when its time to look formal, they do a good job of cleaning up with nice suits, blazers, or even vests.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The stats all say that it's a 30-70 split between Greeks and Non-Greeks, but in the end, it feels more like 40-60. I joined a fraternity and I couldn't be happier, as my brothers have been the best friends I have ever made. There's a house for literally everyone, so don't be afraid that you won't get a bid. At the same time, social doors don't necessarily close to you if you don't rush, as there's no Greek vs. Non-Greek antagonism at Penn.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Policies are generally very lenient and have never prevented me from doing anything I would have otherwise liked to do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'd say that the University makes a very good effort at attracting students with diverse backgrounds and experiences, in all senses, as well as trying to support and promote programming to actually highlight this diversity. However, I think that there is still some work to be done in terms of actually being successful in breaking down self- and societally-imposed barriers that cause students to form "bubbles" around themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students can do almost anything - controlled at a distance
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Underage drinking for example is enforced very much so throughout campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: there are University Police on campus.  The is a security firm that supplies more officers that surround the campus for a 3 block radius.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students really are from all over the world at Penn. Most students come from a fairly privileged background, but thanks to Penn's good financial aid, anyone qualified can come. Also, Penn has lots of religious organizations (even a kosher dining hall) and a hugely active LGBTQ center.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and girls come from all over the nation and the world.  The university is definitely a not party school.  Generally the students are very focused and career minded.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Campus police can be strict, but not too much as long as you keep the streets clear. Most of the fraternities/sororities do a good job of this, and they also keep underage drinking indoors and under control, so most of the times there is not much of a campus-wide problem. But if your music is too loud, obviously they will come visit you. And as always, when you get caught it probably won't do you any good, so be careful in advertising your parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternities and sororities are definitely involved in Penn's social life. However, you do not have to ever step foot into a frat or sorority. There are so many clubs and other organizations that they aren't necessary, even for big parties. On the other hand, there are enough of them (and they are diverse enough), that if you are looking to join Greek life, you'll have lots of opportunity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you want to play, you will play! There are tons of sports, played at any level, from varsity to just goofing around. The Penn Band is a huge part of school spirit and support of our athletic teams. They're at every football and men's basketball game and always bring tons of enthusiasm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Penn is much more concerned for its students' safety than it is about disciplining its students.  Oftentimes a student will be 'written up' for various misdemeanors such as drinking in your dorm room, but all that comes of it is going to a disciplinary hearing where they slap you on the wrist. It is rare for a Penn student to get in serious trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life here at Penn exists but everything here takes a backseat to academic study.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The greek life here is excellent, especially amongst the Black frats.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's not bad and there's some selection.  Plus because of the surrounding colleges there's even more selection.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Tons of diversity here. It is totally a liberal campus, accepting LGBTQ and many races. We have a lot of international students here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is WAY too much of it. It is actually ridiculous and not the right fit for me at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
By the time you get to Post-Bac Grad studies, you are pretty dedicated to academics & have a firm grasp of reality, therefore you are a clean-cut person, nerdy but dress casual nice.  You can still have a great social life & relationships without all the bing drinking.  It's more an
adult approach to the social casual drink.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: As a commuter student, so far, I haven't seen or been involved with any mischief that would give me any other opinion than a safe & well policed campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It's very easy to make friends at this school, lots of different types of people to get to know.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Very fun to live in Philly, Great people, great atmosphere! Lots of places to eat!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: It's Definitely Visible – While the frats and sororities arent to be ignored, you definitely dont have to be involved in one to have a good time. Granted, most people who arent involved in greek life are on sports teams or really involved in clubs, but there are still a large number of people who arent into any of that and still manage to have fun and go out on weekends. The frats offer a nice selection for people who aren't yet 21 to hang out, drink, and just chill without really worrying about getting in trouble for underage drinking (As they would if they were to, say, drink in the dorms).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They Understand – While the Penn police dont treat anything like a joke, the general idea about underage drinking is that they know it's happening, but as long as they dont see it and as long as no one gets hurt / gets into a dangerous situation, they let it go. The medical amnesty policy on campus says that when someone calls for medical attention for a friend who is under the influence of drugs or alcohol, neither the friend nor the sick person can get in trouble for consumption. This is a great policy, in my opinion, because it allows people to feel free to get medical help when they need it, but not worry about getting into trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Doesn't Dominate – Heavy Greek life - a good percentage of people, but mostly for parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse – Penn has a very diverse student body. This means that there is no excuse for you to not make a wonderful group of friends. Penn has a huge international student population. I've met people from all over the world here. Also, penn is very gay-friendly. This means that people of all sexual orientation are free to express themselves and not feel ostracized. Basically, you will definitely meet awesome, interesting people of diverse sexual, religious, ethic backgrounds at Penn.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: A Police Force Focused on the Protection of Students – The police force is not really concerned about the presence of underage drinking . Its members are mainly concerned that students engaging in this behavior do so safely.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Gender Inequity – I don't like how all of the sororities are off campus while the frats are in the center of campus. I understand that women have not always been allowed to attend here, but some things need to change. Its all about location.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Are Average – Varsity sports at Penn are average because students usually are busy doing work.  On weekends and rivalry games (Harvard or Princeton), the crowd is ridiculous (in a good way)!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I would have never thought an Ivy had so many beautiful girls from all around the world. God Bless America.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Penn police are completely understanding of all partying. All you need to do is listen to their requests, for example "turn the music down", etc. and they are fine. Just be respectful, they deal with intoxicated people a lot and are good at it. Also like most schools there is the amnesty policy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very Little Punishment – It is not an unfamiliar site to see a student walking around with an open bottle. The Penn Police are extremely understanding and rarely give students any trouble. The few friends I have who have gotten into trouble with the police have gotten into physical altercations with them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: BASKETBALL!!! The basketball here has suddenly become very big, as we did so well this year. Many people go to games (making up for the lack of attendees at our football games... ouch) to cheer on the Quakers. As a freshman, it was a great way to get into the spirit of the school. Other sports are actually quite good here as well, though many people don't know about them. The gymnastics team won a big championship here this year, as well as a few other sports teams. But if you were to pick the biggest spectator sport here - you'd hear BASKETBALL from everyone who fills the palestra every weekend during basketball season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Some Good Things and Bad Things – *DISCLAIMER- none of these things are meant to be racist/stereotypical... just the truth*

My take on Penn is that there are so many different kinds of people.  There are people you are going to relate to.. and people you're not going to relate to. Overall, here are some pointers:

1)  There is a major Jewish community at Penn, but it kind of keeps to itself.  I don't really know very many Jewish people, but I do eat with friends whenever I go to the Jewish dining hall.

2)  Hella asians.  They are everywhere!  But my roommate was asian and she was the coolest person that I met at Penn.  Just keep an open mind!  There are plenty who won't raise their heads from their Wharton books, but there are tons of really cool ones, too.

3)  People always give Wharton kids a bad rep.  Sure, there are some that just want to build huge capitalistic business empires, but there are some really awesome ones, too.

4)  Personally, I find engineering kids to be less friendly than Wharton kids.  They tend to be very competitive in classes.

So, those were some of things on the "bad" end, I guess.  In reality, every kind of person exists at Penn.  Artsy kids, nerdy kids, sports jocks, everything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Penn is definitely one of the most diverse campuses in the nation.  There are students of every ethnicity, religion, political view, and sexual orientation.  Everyone is accepting of everyone else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: At Upenn, there are many cultures represented, but none so much as an American urban class. People pay a lot of attention to their looks, almost too much so. Most girls you meet are attractive and know how to have fun, while most of the boys try to look cool and collegiate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With so many different people, it's impossible NOT to meet people
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I Do Not Know – I would say that they are welcome here and they being treated fairly and with respect.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Never an Issue – As far as campus security goes, there are Police everywhere for safety reasons.  Penn has the largest private police force in the state after all, but it's all for your safety.  Now, I have never heard of anybody getting a write-up for drinking issues themselves.  Obviously if you assault, rape, steal or something else, the Penn police will arrest you, but for the majority of less severe offenses, their don't really care, and, honestly, you can even ask the Penn security guards for information as to where the parties are, and they'll tell you.
Academic strictness is there, but it's a seldom used venue at the school.  Most everybody here is here to learn and work, otherwise transferring might be your best option.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Nominally, Penn's diverse.  It has kids from however many hundreds of countries and virtually every state, but the majority are from PA, NJ, MD, NY and the like.  Yes, a majority of the school's a "minority", but each contingent of people tends to keep to themselves.  Clicks exist a lot, especially among sports teams, who all join the same frats, etc.

As far as Sexual orientation goes, Penn is one of the most liberal, at least nominally.  It seems as though everybody has the same sort of typical opinions about how wonderful it is to respect persons of different sexual orientations
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: International Crowd – Lots of attractive and intellectual guys and girls!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Great Parties, Great Standard of Living – Greeks make their presence known to freshmen during NSO through their parties.  From that point onwards, many of the finest men and women have their hearts set on rushing.  These parties are essentially the core of the Penn nightlife, and most parties are pretty decent or better.

A factor though, is that for men, frequently a ratio is enforced, generally a 2 girls : 1 guy ratio.  So it really helps to have a lot of girl friends when you do go out.

Greek Housing on the other hand, is a major part of campus life, but it varies wildly in quality from one frat to another.  Some of the frats are housed in notable buildings on campus, while others are housed "on-campus" but a few blocks away from the center.  Again, most frats have pretty decent houses, but some have phenomenal ones.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Shallow People – The girls here are much more attractive than I thought they would be. HOWEVER, the overwhelming majority of them want nothing but to study or get really really drunk. If you're looking for a relationship with a nice, intellectual girl, this place is the most miserable choice imaginable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Strict but Fair – The school has a fair policy in regards to drinking, ensuring that students are responsible: if you end up sick while drinking and go to a local healthcare provider, you will not be penalized. Penn places safety and well being above all else, and the policies reflect that. The college tends to be strict but fair.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Bad – It's not something you typically notice if you've lived in the city all your life, but the guys and girls are pretty normal and cool at Penn. They are diverse in backgrounds so you'll have a lot of different people, but in general everyone gets along pretty well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: At Penn, there is a lot of diversity in race and hometown, but very little diversity in economic status. Obviously they are outliers, but for the most part, most people fit the Penn stereotype.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Don't Worry Too Much – College is, after a lot of hard-working, time for fun and social life. If you like drinking, do it, but don't make it crystal clear for everyone that you're often drunk. It's just a matter of being discrete and moderate. Have fun in way that you'll feel good and won't bother anyone. That's the best advice not only if you're going to Penn, but anywhere else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Social Life With the Greeks – Greek life is quite enormous on Penn's campus, but it does not affect the social life on campus because there are many other activities in which students participate. Greek students are viewed as, groups that want to enjoy life on and off campus. There is plenty of Greek housing available in the University City area. Most of the Greek houses are beautiful four bedroom stone houses, which are close to campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Are Fun but Not Central – There is a good amount of support for sports teams, and there are lots of great traditions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys Look Better Than Girls – On average, just walking around campus, you'll notice that guys tend to be better looking than girls, but there's still plenty to look forward to. There's a wide variety of backgrounds and interests, so you'll be able to find someone you'd like to date whether you're artsy, sporty, geeky, or all about high-rollin'.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: After Spring Rush is over, about 30% of the campus is a member of the Greek community. An overwhelming majority of parties at UPenn are hosted at fraternity houses and the Office of Frat and Sorority Affairs is one of the largest in the country. There are over 30 fraternities (including the multicultural frats/sororities) and 9 sororities now.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Penn's campus is remarkably diverse. Greek Life and Athletics are as diverse as the rest of campus. Rated #1 LGBT-friendly campus and with one of the number one Jewish student centers in the country, Penn is very accepting and accommodating of all people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Interesting People – A very interesting mix of people. Many beautiful girls. A roughly 25% Jewish population. Lots of intellectual types. Pretty much all cultural sterotypes are represented here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: You're Grown So Live Your Life – The University of Pennsylvania is not strict at all. They understand that we are all young adults that need to take responsibility for our own actions. Even if a freshmen gets too drunk and needs to be admitted to a hospital, they have a program where the student won't get into any trouble, just because they were responsible enough to get help. UPenn trusts its students to make the right decisions at all times!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: guys are geeky, but lots of options – A lot of the guys here are very nerdy, but then again, there are the hot guys. Some frat guys seem pretty sleazy, but overall most seem to be good, interesting people. Drexel students tend to crash our parties, which can be a good thing or a bad thing depending on your perspective (it does add variety).
Student%20Life.Author: Niche User

Student%20Life.Review: Penn isn't strict at all. They have their own private police force for campus, who don't seem in the least concerned with underage drinking. If you live off-campus, things  are even more lenient. Also, their are policies in place so that if you go to the hospital for alcohol-related issues, you will not be persecuted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: You Make It What You Want It to Be – Rushing is a landmark time in the spring semester. Some students who decide from beforehand that they will participate will reduce their workload because they know that rushing will take up a huge amount of time. Apart from rushing, once you're in you pretty much have complete control over how involved you wish to become in Greek life. A party atmosphere surrounds the sorority and fraternity houses and they are typically at their most active starting Thursday and up until Sunday night.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Hardly Any School Spirit – UPenn is not really a sport school. Homecoming is the hilight of the year when everyone gets to throw toast on the filed. The Penn relays are also held there in the spring which brings people from all over the country. But other than that, Penn students are not so into sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Diveristy, Little Mixing – Pretty diverse campus but a lot of self segregation occurs. Most people befriend and associate people that look like them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life seems to have a pretty significant presence, but I would say the majority are not involved, or if they are, not significantly. It's not really a big deal either way, and you can go to parties and stuff whether or not you are affiliated with the frat.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Just Be Responsible. The administration and the advisers know what's going on; many of them are cool about it as long as you're safe. There's increased vigilance during Spring Fling because that's when the entire school goes crazy, and I have heard stories of parties getting busted but students usually do not get in trouble. Penn does a good job of letting kids have fun while encouraging them to take responsibility for their actions. If you are caught, they won't punish you but you're trusted to know not to do it again.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good Mix – There is a good mix of students from all over hte country as well as the world, and the spectrum reaches from one end of the nation's socio-economic status to the other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Football is the biggest sport at Penn; the homecoming game is always anticipated. Outside of that, however, I feel that many students aren't really into the sports scene. But we do host the Penn Relays every spring, and that receives a lot of spectators. The facilities are great, with Franklin Field and Pottruck gym (free for students).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fun for Some, but Not Too Important – Sports aren't too huge at Penn, but for those who do participate they can be great.  We have great facilities, a lot of options (including intramural and club sports) and some great traditions, including throwing toast at football halftimes.  The Penn Relays are also at Penn.  The grade is somewhat low, though, because sports aren't a huge part of most students' college experience here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Top tier academics, but you have to be ready to put in a lot of work to succeed
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics are unparalleled. Great classes, great professors, and great opportunities. Course registration is relatively easy. Expect to work hard, but you'll get a lot out of it.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The academics at Penn are second to none.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Some very good professors and courses which may or may not be of interest to different people
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Many study spaces. Several types of environments whether you like studying with music, silence they've got you covered
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The workload is manageable. The registration process is simple but it is sometimes a hassle to get into the class you want once it has reached full capacity.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I was able to find various jobs on campus rather easily. If you are Wharton, it definitely is easier to do so. However, there are enough opportunities in general.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Haven't really looked at it
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I feel like I am exactly where I belong. The classes I am taking are perfect and I am enjoying every second of it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: To get in you have to apply to Penn as well as your specific school. The most important thing is showing passion for what you want to study and showing a true desire to attend Penn. The Nursing school is the best!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm  a Cog Sci major and I love it because it's interdiscplinary and the professors are very interesting.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There is almost limitless possibilities, especially with Penn's emphasis on interdisciplinary studies. Want to combine English and Finance? No problem! Penn will help you make it happen.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Professors are some of the best in academics and dedicated to teaching
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Curriculum and workload is rigorous, professors are great
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Be well rounded and be confident in your interview
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Lets you learn a lot and get used to the professional environment
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The unique aspects of my major range from our internship opportunities, teachers, and peers involved. My university offers a range of internships, the most remarkable, in my opinion, being our partnership with the Cannes film festival.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: A unique experience that I was able to be apart of at my University was my enrollment in a class taught by Paul Sylbert. Paul Sylbert is an academy award winning production designer. The experience taught me so much just by absorbing the wisdom from Mr. Sylbert.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The College does not provide a prelaw major which I wanted
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The program provides interesting courses and access to guest professors
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors at Penn are often the top of their field. They also provide a great deal of insight into their field which goes beyond what might be offered at other schools.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The Political Science program offers interesting professors and great internship opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Study abroad, huge range of classes available, wonderful professors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Wharton is a really excellent business school. Professors are very friendly and accessible as is the support staff. All kinds of opportunities available to study different areas.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Kids in programs have a better sense of community rather than getting lost within the whole school.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: A lot of people are focused on getting internships from the very beginning.  While it is difficult when you're younger, once you become a junior, you're one of the most competitive candidates.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It is pretty easy to switch programs within your respective school.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Great variety of academic choices.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The Economics program at UPenn is world renowned and very rigorous. Being in introductory courses there is not a lot of individual attention unless you seek it and the work is heavily math based.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm currently working towards an Environmental Studies major. The department is fantastic and the advisors are very friendly. There are plenty of options within the major for specializations and concentrations. I highly recommend it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I only just declared so I don't have much experience with the deparment, but the department heads are always sending out email with internship and job opportunities. There are also a lot of invitations to events with in the EES department.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics are good, but they are incredibly hard. If you don't plan on studying and working your ass off for more than 40 hours a week, don't bother coming. Professors are really hit-or-miss, as they would be at any school. The upper-level classes generally are more interesting and have better professors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Heavy workload and intense environment, but lots of opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Linguistics at Penn is one of the best in the world, but the undergraduate curriculum seems to value breadth rather than depth, and I never felt like I really built up my knowledge of any one thing but rather took Intro level classes in several areas, which often meant relearning the same basic material, albeit with slightly different goals.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Not many issues, although a few issues with email communication and responses.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: An education from UPenn is great, since all of the students and faculty are always willing to help and act as a resource!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The nursing school is amazing with great simulation labs.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Nursing is tied with Johns Hopkins and the University of Washington at being the best Nursing School in the country.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I enjoy my English major because we have some of the top professors in the world, who are also very kind and helpful.  The workload is rigorous but manageable.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: For my major and interest, my internship experiences have varied. I have had the most interesting experiences at those internships I've held in the entertainment industry however those were unpaid and thus presented an unfortunate downside. The corporate internship I held it was well payed, required long hours as well as a large amount of responsibility.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: There are so many majors to choose from.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The Penn curriculum has some general requirements that students in all courses of study have to fulfill. The registration process is very flexible and not to cutthroat.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The international relations department is awesome. Beyond just providing a great curriculum, the heads of the department support students in the trajectory of selecting a career and getting employment.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors, well, not exactly what I expected.  Some are hard to understand and I am glad we have study sessions.  the automated registration process is easy and they give many ways to research classes.  Academic advising is not good as its forced on professors - not volunteer.  Luckily other students are willing to help with this.
